# lubridate

## Overview

Date-time data can be frustrating to work with in R. R commands for
date-times are generally unintuitive and change depending on the type of
date-time object being used. Moreover, the methods we use with
date-times must be robust to time zones, leap days, daylight savings
times, and other time related quirks, and R lacks these capabilities in
some situations. Lubridate makes it easier to do the things R does with
date-times and possible to do the things R does not.

If you are new to lubridate, the best place to start is the [date and
times chapter](https://r4ds.hadley.nz/datetimes.html) in R for data
science.

## Installation

``` r
# The easiest way to get lubridate is to install the whole tidyverse:
install.packages("tidyverse")

# Alternatively, install just lubridate:
install.packages("lubridate")

# Or the development version from GitHub:
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("tidyverse/lubridate")
```

## Cheatsheet

[![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rstudio/cheatsheets/main/pngs/thumbnails/lubridate-cheatsheet-thumbs.png)](https://rawgit.com/rstudio/cheatsheets/main/lubridate.pdf)

## Features

``` r
library(lubridate, warn.conflicts = FALSE)
```

- Easy and fast parsing of date-times:
  [`ymd()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/ymd.md),
  `ymd_hms`,
  [`dmy()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/ymd.md),
  `dmy_hms`,
  [`mdy()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/ymd.md), …

  ``` r
  ymd(20101215)
  #> [1] "2010-12-15"
  mdy("4/1/17")
  #> [1] "2017-04-01"
  ```

- Simple functions to get and set components of a date-time, such as
  [`year()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/year.md),
  [`month()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/month.md),
  [`mday()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/day.md),
  [`hour()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/hour.md),
  [`minute()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/minute.md) and
  [`second()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/second.md):

  ``` r
  bday <- dmy("14/10/1979")
  month(bday)
  #> [1] 10
  wday(bday, label = TRUE)
  #> [1] Sun
  #> Levels: Sun < Mon < Tue < Wed < Thu < Fri < Sat

  year(bday) <- 2016
  wday(bday, label = TRUE)
  #> [1] Fri
  #> Levels: Sun < Mon < Tue < Wed < Thu < Fri < Sat
  ```

- Helper functions for handling time zones:
  [`with_tz()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/with_tz.md),
  [`force_tz()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/force_tz.md)

  ``` r
  time <- ymd_hms("2010-12-13 15:30:30")
  time
  #> [1] "2010-12-13 15:30:30 UTC"

  # Changes printing
  with_tz(time, "America/Chicago")
  #> [1] "2010-12-13 09:30:30 CST"

  # Changes time
  force_tz(time, "America/Chicago")
  #> [1] "2010-12-13 15:30:30 CST"
  ```

Lubridate also expands the type of mathematical operations that can be
performed with date-time objects. It introduces three new time span
classes borrowed from <https://www.joda.org>.

- `durations`, which measure the exact amount of time between two points

- `periods`, which accurately track clock times despite leap years, leap
  seconds, and day light savings time

- `intervals`, a protean summary of the time information between two
  points

## Code of Conduct

Please note that the lubridate project is released with a [Contributor
Code of Conduct](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.html).
By contributing to this project, you agree to abide by its terms.

# Package index

## Date/time parsing

- [`ymd()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/ymd.md)
  [`ydm()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/ymd.md)
  [`mdy()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/ymd.md)
  [`myd()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/ymd.md)
  [`dmy()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/ymd.md)
  [`dym()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/ymd.md)
  [`yq()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/ymd.md)
  [`ym()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/ymd.md)
  [`my()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/ymd.md) :

  Parse dates with **y**ear, **m**onth, and **d**ay components

- [`ymd_hms()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/ymd_hms.md)
  [`ymd_hm()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/ymd_hms.md)
  [`ymd_h()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/ymd_hms.md)
  [`dmy_hms()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/ymd_hms.md)
  [`dmy_hm()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/ymd_hms.md)
  [`dmy_h()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/ymd_hms.md)
  [`mdy_hms()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/ymd_hms.md)
  [`mdy_hm()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/ymd_hms.md)
  [`mdy_h()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/ymd_hms.md)
  [`ydm_hms()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/ymd_hms.md)
  [`ydm_hm()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/ymd_hms.md)
  [`ydm_h()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/ymd_hms.md) :

  Parse date-times with **y**ear, **m**onth, and **d**ay, **h**our,
  **m**inute, and **s**econd components.

- [`ms()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/hms.md)
  [`hm()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/hms.md)
  [`hms()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/hms.md) :

  Parse periods with **h**our, **m**inute, and **s**econd components

- [`parse_date_time()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/parse_date_time.md)
  [`parse_date_time2()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/parse_date_time.md)
  [`fast_strptime()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/parse_date_time.md)
  : User friendly date-time parsing functions

- [`guess_formats()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/guess_formats.md)
  : Guess possible date-times formats from a character vector

## Setting, getting, and rounding

- [`year()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/year.md)
  [`` `year<-`() ``](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/year.md)
  [`isoyear()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/year.md)
  [`epiyear()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/year.md) :
  Get/set years component of a date-time
- [`quarter()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/quarter.md)
  [`semester()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/quarter.md) :
  Get the fiscal quarter and semester of a date-time
- [`month()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/month.md)
  [`` `month<-`() ``](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/month.md)
  : Get/set months component of a date-time
- [`week()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/week.md)
  [`` `week<-`() ``](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/week.md)
  [`isoweek()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/week.md)
  [`epiweek()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/week.md) :
  Get/set weeks component of a date-time
- [`day()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/day.md)
  [`mday()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/day.md)
  [`wday()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/day.md)
  [`qday()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/day.md)
  [`yday()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/day.md)
  [`` `day<-`() ``](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/day.md)
  [`` `mday<-`() ``](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/day.md)
  [`` `qday<-`() ``](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/day.md)
  [`` `wday<-`() ``](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/day.md)
  [`` `yday<-`() ``](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/day.md) :
  Get/set days component of a date-time
- [`hour()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/hour.md)
  [`` `hour<-`() ``](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/hour.md)
  : Get/set hours component of a date-time
- [`minute()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/minute.md)
  [`` `minute<-`() ``](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/minute.md)
  : Get/set minutes component of a date-time
- [`second()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/second.md)
  [`` `second<-`() ``](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/second.md)
  : Get/set seconds component of a date-time
- [`tz()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/tz.md)
  [`` `tz<-`() ``](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/tz.md) :
  Get/set time zone component of a date-time

## Date-time helpers

- [`as_date()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/as_date.md)
  [`as_datetime()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/as_date.md)
  : Convert an object to a date or date-time
- [`cyclic_encoding()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/cyclic_encoding.md)
  : Cyclic encoding of date-times
- [`date()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/date.md)
  [`` `date<-`() ``](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/date.md)
  : Get/set date component of a date-time
- [`decimal_date()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/decimal_date.md)
  : Converts a date to a decimal of its year
- [`is.Date()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/date_utils.md)
  [`Date()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/date_utils.md)
  [`NA_Date_`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/date_utils.md)
  : Various date utilities
- [`is.POSIXt()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/posix_utils.md)
  [`is.POSIXlt()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/posix_utils.md)
  [`is.POSIXct()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/posix_utils.md)
  [`POSIXct()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/posix_utils.md)
  [`NA_POSIXct_`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/posix_utils.md)
  : Various POSIX utilities
- [`is.instant()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/is.instant.md)
  [`is.timepoint()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/is.instant.md)
  : Is x a date-time object?
- [`make_datetime()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/make_datetime.md)
  [`make_date()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/make_datetime.md)
  : Efficient creation of date-times from numeric representations
- [`now()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/now.md)
  [`today()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/now.md) : The
  current day and time
- [`origin`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/origin.md) :
  1970-01-01 UTC

## Durations

A ‘duration’ is a timespan measured in seconds.

- [`duration()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/duration.md)
  [`dseconds()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/duration.md)
  [`dminutes()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/duration.md)
  [`dhours()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/duration.md)
  [`ddays()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/duration.md)
  [`dweeks()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/duration.md)
  [`dmonths()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/duration.md)
  [`dyears()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/duration.md)
  [`dmilliseconds()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/duration.md)
  [`dmicroseconds()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/duration.md)
  [`dnanoseconds()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/duration.md)
  [`dpicoseconds()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/duration.md)
  [`is.duration()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/duration.md)
  : Create a duration object.
- [`is.difftime()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/is.difftime.md)
  : Is x a difftime object?
- [`make_difftime()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/make_difftime.md)
  : Create a difftime object.
- [`as.duration()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/as.duration.md)
  : Change an object to a duration
- [`Duration-class`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/Duration-class.md)
  [`durations`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/Duration-class.md)
  : Duration class

## Periods

A ‘period’ is a timespan defined in civil time (human) units like years,
months, and days.

- [`period()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/period.md)
  [`is.period()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/period.md)
  [`seconds()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/period.md)
  [`minutes()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/period.md)
  [`hours()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/period.md)
  [`days()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/period.md)
  [`weeks()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/period.md)
  [`years()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/period.md)
  [`milliseconds()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/period.md)
  [`microseconds()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/period.md)
  [`nanoseconds()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/period.md)
  [`picoseconds()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/period.md)
  [`months(`*`<numeric>`*`)`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/period.md)
  : Create or parse period objects
- [`period_to_seconds()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/period_to_seconds.md)
  [`seconds_to_period()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/period_to_seconds.md)
  : Contrive a period to/from a given number of seconds
- [`as.period()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/as.period.md)
  : Change an object to a period
- [`Period-class`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/Period-class.md)
  : Period class

## Intervals

An `interval` is a timespan defined by two date-times.

- [`interval()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/interval.md)
  [`` `%--%` ``](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/interval.md)
  [`is.interval()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/interval.md)
  [`int_start()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/interval.md)
  [`` `int_start<-`() ``](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/interval.md)
  [`int_end()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/interval.md)
  [`` `int_end<-`() ``](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/interval.md)
  [`int_length()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/interval.md)
  [`int_flip()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/interval.md)
  [`int_shift()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/interval.md)
  [`int_overlaps()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/interval.md)
  [`int_standardize()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/interval.md)
  [`int_aligns()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/interval.md)
  [`int_diff()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/interval.md)
  :

  Utilities for creation and manipulation of `Interval` objects

- [`as.interval()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/as.interval.md)
  :

  Change an object to an `interval`

- [`` `%within%` ``](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/within-interval.md)
  : Does a date (or interval) fall within an interval?

- [`Interval-class`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/Interval-class.md)
  [`intervals`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/Interval-class.md)
  : Interval class

## Timespans

Timespans are the generic concept that underlies durations, periods, and
intervals.

- [`timespan`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/timespan.md)
  [`timespans`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/timespan.md) :
  Description of time span classes in lubridate
- [`time_length()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/time_length.md)
  : Compute the exact length of a time span
- [`is.timespan()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/is.timespan.md)
  : Is x a length of time?

## Formatters

- [`stamp()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/stamp.md)
  [`stamp_date()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/stamp.md)
  [`stamp_time()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/stamp.md) :
  Format dates and times based on human-friendly templates
- [`format_ISO8601()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/format_ISO8601.md)
  : Format in ISO8601 character format

## Other modification functions

- [`update(`*`<POSIXt>`*`)`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/DateTimeUpdate.md)
  : Changes the components of a date object
- [`fit_to_timeline()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/fit_to_timeline.md)
  : Fit a POSIXlt date-time to the timeline
- [`with_tz()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/with_tz.md) :
  Get date-time in a different time zone
- [`force_tz()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/force_tz.md)
  [`force_tzs()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/force_tz.md)
  : Replace time zone to create new date-time
- [`round_date()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/round_date.md)
  [`floor_date()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/round_date.md)
  [`ceiling_date()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/round_date.md)
  : Round, floor and ceiling methods for date-time objects
- [`pretty_dates()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/pretty_dates.md)
  : Computes attractive axis breaks for date-time data
- [`rollbackward()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/rollbackward.md)
  [`rollback()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/rollbackward.md)
  [`rollforward()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/rollbackward.md)
  : Roll backward or forward a date the previous, current or next month
- [`` `%m+%` ``](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/mplus.md)
  [`add_with_rollback()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/mplus.md)
  : Add and subtract months to a date without exceeding the last day of
  the new month
- [`local_time()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/local_time.md)
  : Get local time from a date-time vector.

## Other date-time components

- [`am()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/am.md)
  [`pm()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/am.md) : Does date
  time occur in the am or pm?

- [`days_in_month()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/days_in_month.md)
  : Get the number of days in the month of a date-time

- [`dst()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/dst.md) :

  Get **d**aylight **s**avings **t**ime indicator of a date-time

- [`leap_year()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/leap_year.md)
  : Is a year a leap year?

- [`date_decimal()`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/date_decimal.md)
  : Converts a decimal to a date

## Data

- [`lakers`](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/reference/lakers.md) :
  Lakers 2008-2009 basketball data set

# Articles

### All vignettes

- [Do more with dates and times in
  R](https://lubridate.tidyverse.org/articles/lubridate.md):
